The Indian Super League (ISL) is a professional football league in India, launched in 2014 as a key part of the country's efforts to elevatequa the sport's profile. Modeled on successful football leagues around the world, the ISL features a mix of Indian and international players, aiming to boost football's popularity and develop local talent. It operates as one of the top-tier football competitions in India, attracting significant viewership and sponsorship, and has become a major platform for showcasing football talent in the region.

The league typically runs from November to March, with teams representing various cities and regions across India. Each season culminates in a playoff system, leading to a final that determines the champion. The ISL has played a crucial role in increasing the visibility of football in India, enhancing the standard of the domestic game, and contributing to the growth of grassroots football. Through its high-profile matches and international partnerships, the league continues to promote the sport and inspire future generations of footballers in India.
